description:
Sr. Data Scientist - Hybrid

Category: Software Development/Engineering

Main location: United States, Texas, Dallas

Alternate Location(s): United States, New Jersey, New Brunswick

United States, Virginia, Reston

United States, Tennessee, Knoxville

United States, Pennsylvania, Pittsburgh

United States, South Carolina, Columbia

Position ID: J0224-1833

Employment Type: Full Time

Position Description:

CGI has an immediate need for a Sr. Data Scientist to join our financial services team. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced team environment supporting one of the largest leaders in the secondary mortgage industry. We take an innovative approach to supporting our client, working side-by-side in an agile environment using emerging technologies.
• We partner with 15 of the top 20 banks globally, and our top 10 banking clients have worked with us for an average of 26 years!
• We have over 73,000+ CGI Members in 40 countries and over 5k+ loyal Clients who are leveraging our end-to-end services across the globe.

This position is based in either Reston, VA or Plano/Dallas TX, or anywhere in the US where CGI has an office in the Central/Eastern Time Zones.

Your future duties and responsibilities:

Seeking a Senior Data Scientist to join the Data Science Program. The Senior Associate will help us build security models provide assistance in building, improving, and actualizing risk processes related to model risk. As a key member of the team, you can anticipate significant interaction with the entire global MRM group and model risk stakeholders, where you will need to communicate effectively with a wide range of people and cultures. Possible examples of work product include analyzing, reporting and automating analysis of MRM Framework compliance and results, undertaking special projects to work with MRM stakeholders to identify and achieve greater consistency and efficiencies through enhancements to processes and reporting within the MRM framework, playing a key role in maintaining the accuracy of MRM's reporting platform, supporting model inventory management activities, drafting model risk compliance statistics and other MRM framework updates for the Model Risk Management Committee, and supporting model guideline compliance with corporate requirements.?

Required qualifications to be successful in this role:

8-10 years of experience in consulting, data analysis, model risk management, project management, or a related field is preferred

Excellent quantitative problem-solving skills with experience in stochastic modeling, statistics, and machine learning.

Hands-on experience in programming Python or R.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills with fluency in English and the ability to explain complex problems in a simple way.

Good understanding of financial products and markets.

Team player skills, motivation, and ability to work independently within a global and diverse team.

Dedication to fostering an inclusive culture and value diverse perspectives. Education Requirement

Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Systems or related field?.

CGI is required by law in some jurisdictions to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. The determination of this range includes various factors not limited to skill set, level, experience, relevant training, and licensure and certifications. To support the ability to reward for merit-based performance, CGI typically does not hire individuals at or near the top of the range for their role. Compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range for this role in the U.S. is $59,700.00 - $146,900.00.

At CGI we call our professionals "members" to reinforce that all who join our team are, as owners, empowered to participate in the challenges and rewards that come from building a world-class company. CGI's benefits include:
• Competitive base salaries
• Eligibility to participate in an attractive Share Purchase Plan (SPP) in which the company matches dollar-for-dollar contributions made by eligible employees, up to a maximum, for their job category
• 401(k) Plan and Profit Participation for eligible members
• Generous holidays, vacation, and sick leave plans
• Comprehensive insurance plans that include, among other benefits, medical, dental, vision, life, disability, out-of-county emergency coverage in all countries of employment.
• Back-up childcare, Pet insurance, a Member Assistance Program, a 529 college savings program, a personal financial management tool, lifestyle management programs and more.
• CGI anticipates accepting applications for this position through April 5th, 2024.

Skills:
• Analytical Thinking
• Data Analysis
• Project Management
• Python

What you can expect from us:

Insights you can act on

While technology is at the heart of our clients' digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.

When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today - one of the world's largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.

At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.

Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI - where your ideas and actions make a difference.
